website_summaries.verdict: An easy to use smoker with good smoke and temperature control.
pros: Model comes with starter hickory chips
Moderate price for a decent product
Provides a good flavor on the meat
cons: This model doesn't seem to hold up in the weather as well as other Masterbuilt models

customer_reviews.title: Company doesn't stand behind the quality of their product and didn't make it right.
customer_reviews.text: I was enjoying the use of this smoker for jerky, pork chops, beer can chicken, even cold smoking cheeses. However, about the ninth time using it l, it stopped working and I discovered that it had suffered a major failure that burnt up all the insulation within. Additionally, despite hearing good things about Masterbuilt standing behindo their products, the company refused to replace the faulty smoker and instead were just wanting to send me a replacement box that wouldn't show up for over 3 months. Very disappointed in Masterbuilt! Be warned.
customer_reviews.author: Bill E. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Great smoker after a few fixes
customer_reviews.text: With a few minor adjustments this smoker is perfect. First I took the chip tray rack out to let it sit directly on the coils. I flipped a bracket that is over top of the heating element and put it below. Lastly I drilled about 12 very small holes in the chip tray. After making these adjustments this thing started rolling out smoke. Did two whole chickens and they turned out fantastic. For the price point its worth making the few adjustments, highly recommend for any home smoker. Only complaint is that the digital controls are hard to read when in direct sunlight but this is a minor inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Batman

customer_reviews.title: This is a great smoker for the money -- even a bit more ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great smoker for the money -- even a bit more money. The only reason I gave it 3 stars if because nowhere does it let the user know that it doesn't really generate smoke below 180-200 degrees. So if you're doing sticks, or salmon or a slow roast brisket, you need to always spike the temperature, generate smoke and then turn it back down. If you want a first rate smoke experience, get the cold smoke generator with it. It costs $60 more but you'll have a 5-star smoker for a great price price. If you plan on smoking above 200 degrees, this is a great unit all by itself.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: After first use, following directions,Paint peeled on the inside of smoker. Must not have used a good quality high temperature paint. Would never buy another Masterbuilt smoker. Must be seconds sold on Amazon. Also purchased a warranty. Will try to return it if they get back with me.
customer_reviews.author: cindy  Q

customer_reviews.title: A great smoker; everything you would want
customer_reviews.text: I am not familiar with this brand, so I was hesitant to buy it. I am completely sold on it. I have used it about a dozen times in 2 months. I have done beef, pork, chicken and turkey. Everything has turned out great. It was easy to assemble. I really like the digital controls; just set the temperature and the time. It is easy to add chips for smoke; I really like that you don't have to open the smoker to add chips. I haven't cold smoked anything yet, but I am sure that will work just as well. I am completely satisfied; a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Selby

customer_reviews.title: newer model is a waste of money!!
customer_reviews.text: I own 3 of these first of all and when I say 3, I mean older model's and I love them which is what I thought I ordered this time. Lol. No I get a newer version of the 30" master built. I will never purchase one again, you might as well use your oven, won't even get the wood chips got enough to smoke in this model not to mention the wood chip holder is about half the size of my other 3.I would really like to hear from master built to see why they couldn't leave well enough alone just wasted my money on this smoker and no I would not recommend this model to my worst enemy.
customer_reviews.author: Matt favreau

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT BUY! Control Panel SUCKS!!!
customer_reviews.text: The control panel died after 5 uses. You can’t imagine the frustration of prepping a brisket the night before and waiting in anticipation to start smoking it at 0600 the next morning for a dinner meal, only to go out to start the smoker and have it not work. Angry and disappointed are understatements! It has never been outside and kept in my garage. When I pulled off the control panel, there was moisture. It has never been in the elements! Must be from getting hot and then cooling down moisture builds up. Poor design and completely unreliable product. I will never buy again and will tell everyone I know what a piece of garbage this product is.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Stallman

customer_reviews.title: Electrical Gremlins (Update)
customer_reviews.text: The electric circuit board went haywire during the first cook. Switching the temp cook and timer at random and unable to set the proper temperature and time without it going crazy. This smoker is GARBAGE! Spend the extra money and don't waste the $80 worth of meat and the disappointment of your guests. Update 06\07\19: I emailed Masterbuilt about the problem. After a bit of back and forth they mailed me a replacement control panel. So far it seems to be working.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: New user
customer_reviews.text: I got this smoker to replace the small electric one by Masterbuilt. Using it per instructions does not produce sufficient smoke. I found out by preloading the too small bin with plenty of chips, it give enough smoke to get started and you can keep using the slide loader after that. I plan to take out the chip holder inside the smoker and make a larger metal holder in contact with the heater coils to get a better start on smoking. Everything else work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Harold J. Hanlin

customer_reviews.title: Does not smoke enough
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Well built, practically no assembly required. Cons: Not much smoke produced -- which is kind of the point for a "smoker". I wish I had returned it when I could. Any tricks to get more smoke going? -- I don't want to spend another $50 for addon smoke maker --
customer_reviews.author: GoodCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Chip tray is kind of small but that problem can be easily fixed with a pellet tube
customer_reviews.text: Can complain for the price, it does the trick. Chip tray is kind of small but that problem can be easily fixed with a pellet tube, which is all of $12 on amazon and gives you great smoke.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Not happy at all with product or Mastercraft support
customer_reviews.text: Not happy at all with product or Mastercraft support. I can't keep smoke going at temperatures below 260. Varied the amount of wood chips and airflow with no success. Contacted support through Masterbuilt website on June 22nd and didn't get a reply until July 12th only to have them regurgitate what was already in the manual. Applied what advice they gave me the following weekend with the same crummy results......now I'm past the return period.
customer_reviews.author: David Clouse

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time
customer_reviews.text: Quit working within 10 minutes. Been over a month still trying to get a warranty claim from masterbuilt.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Temperature maintaines consistently and it produces a lot of smoke. I personally do not soak my wood chips and the smolder fine at the 225 degree mark. I add more chips every 2 hours during smoking. The door seals good and all you get is a steady stream of smoke out of the smoke vent. When I’m done I place all of my racks and drip pans in the dishwasher and wipe down the interior with a wet cloth.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Smoker That Does Not Smoke
customer_reviews.text: I had Masterbuilt smoker before and was very happy with it. When it died an untimely death I decided to purchase this one. I had immediately noticed that its internal design had changed. Which is fine - as long as it works. Well, it does not. The problem is that this smoker does not produce smoke. The attached is a picture of the Wood Chip Tray after smoking at 230 degrees for 4 hours. I had put chips in the first 1.5 hour at 30 minutes intervals. As you can see, there are some ashes in the tray - but most of the chips did not burn. The meat came out cooked - but does not have the required smell.
customer_reviews.author: Boris

customer_reviews.title: Would be a 5-star product if you could see the LED display
customer_reviews.text: This is our first smoker so don't have a lot to compare it to, but it's very easy to use and makes efficient use of the chips, and the meat turns out great! Unfortunately, the LED display is so dim you can only see it at night. Maybe we're crazy for smoking meat during the day, but I can't see the readout even if cup my hands over the display to try and block out the sunlight and strain to see it. This makes the unit extremely difficult and frustrating to program and use. Therefore, it's an "okay" product that is only one fixed design flaw away from being awesome.
customer_reviews.author: My Eyes Are Up Here!

customer_reviews.title: Easy fix to no smoke due to wood chip pan design flaw
customer_reviews.text: There is def a design flaw with the wood chip pan and heating element which doesn’t allow the smoker to produce and smoke on low temp cooks 225 degrees and lower. However, I took the wood chip pan and drilled small holes throughout the pan to allow the heat to heat up the wood chips, and by the time it hit 100 degrees it was pumping smoke out . I made sure to check it a few different times to see if the wood caught fire, which it did not . This easy fix worked for me so maybe it’ll work for you! Otherwise this is the second masterbuilt I’ve owned and love them
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good at cooking, not so good at smoking
customer_reviews.text: Only produces smoke while the heating element is on. For the first hour or so it smokes pretty well but after everything inside is good and hot, the element doesn't come on very often. In a 10 hour session it didn't even use up the second load of chips.
customer_reviews.author: Michael T.

customer_reviews.title: Great Smoker For The Price!
customer_reviews.text: I would put this smoker in competition with any $1500 smoker. If holds the temperature within a few degrees as long as you set the damper on top correctly. It has a nice feature where you can fill a pan with water, juice, etc. that will evaporate keeping the meat moist and adding flavor. This model does not have the capability of a controller unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, easy to use. Needs a longer power cord.
customer_reviews.text: Very preliminary review of setup and first burn(seasoning). Stupid easy to assemble...2 screws and 4 bolts. Clean the racks with soap and water, let dry and your ready for a first burn. Only issue is the recommendation to have 10 feet of space between the smoker and combustible material...with the 5 foot(approx) power cord? Sure, just get an extension cord but make sure it's a heavy duty one. I've just been smoking meats for about 20 years, usually using propane, and all I have to say is WOW, is this easy to use. I'll be putting it thru more rigorous tests over the next month and will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: Timer/Temp control unit failed after 10 hours
customer_reviews.text: I should have listened to the reviews that stated it had a bad temp control/timer unit. Mine failed on second use and right in the middle of a brisket cook. What a disappointment
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very bad product
customer_reviews.text: I place an order on November/2017. After a couple misunderstanding with the delivery I received the smoker on January. I used twice and stopped working. The problem was bad insulation for the electrical components. It was overheated and mealt. How was in warranty, the company send me a new component telling me that was the only solution they have and I installed. Today, after all this months, I bring it out to used, started smoking and half hour Iater stop working again. I paid 100 something dollars for an smoker that smoked one brisket and one pork shoulder. Now is in the thash.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Lizardo

customer_reviews.title: 1 problem after another
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I have to my review. In under a year I've had nothing but problems. I've had a new head unit, 2 circuit boards and an entire main body sent to me. Brought it out from storage and immediately needed to change the head unit. Cooked it off for a couple of hours, went back to use the next day and it wouldn't start up. Did some trouble shooting, got it started up but now it won't heat up because it thinks it's 300 degrees inside.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Klopf

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this
customer_reviews.text: I used it 6 times, I waited a month before I used it. So I cannot return it. So on the sixth time using it, I turned it on and after about 20 minutes there was a small explosion and I unplugged it and the smoke that came out was horrible .It was definitely burning electrical smoke, so needless to say I had to throw the meat away. I will buy one from a store that I can return it to if there is a problem with it.
customer_reviews.author: David R.

customer_reviews.title: Makes the best deer jerkey
customer_reviews.text: We have used this smoker at least 5 times and it works great makes the best smoked food and its very big !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Control Panel
customer_reviews.text: I wish they would invest a little more in the control panel. I'd happily pay another $20 for a good one. My first use: smoked pork butt for 4 hours before bed, and left it on throughout the night. I woke up to a cold smoker and an error message beeping on the smoker. I also had this error message occur several times when I did the pre-season but thought it had worked itself out when it stayed on for 4 hours while being monitored. Of course Amazon customer service is great and they are sending me a replacement. Hopefully it was just a faulty unit and the replacement doesn't have problems.
customer_reviews.author: BAH

customer_reviews.title: Poor temp recovery!
customer_reviews.text: Had a hard time holding temp as desired. Temp recovery after preheating and then inserting meat is impossible. It never again reaches the original set temperature. It is about 25-35 degrees lower. The ease of use and everything was ok to and meat still seemed to smoke alright, but just really struggles with temp maintainability
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: I would pass on this smoker  Broke after one try
customer_reviews.text: Broke after first time. Seasoned the unit and on the second (first true use) the control panel wouldn’t allow me to set the temp or time. Spent some time fiddling with it and still broke. Masterbuilts cuts svc is only open 8-5 M-F. This is when most people who have issues don’t smoke. They smoke on the weekends. I would pass on this smoker
customer_reviews.author: Shopalot

customer_reviews.title: Name brand but this one doesn't stand up.
customer_reviews.text: I dint send it back because I had it for a while before I really looked at it. But its made from very cheap materials. the design is like others I have owned and loved, but this one is made from cheap and very thin metal. It presents cut hazards on sheet metal parts inside. Also, the smoking chips cylinder is is very small and cheap. I am disappointed and don't recommend this model. Shame on Masterbuilt for selling this one and hurting the image I once had of the company.
customer_reviews.author: Raul

customer_reviews.title: love it, first time ran it for 18 hours ...
customer_reviews.text: love it, first time ran it for 18 hours with a 7 pound pork but. Burning apple wood chips, awesome
customer_reviews.author: Michael N.

customer_reviews.title: Where's the SMOKE!!!!?
customer_reviews.text: I had a previous model of a Masterbuilt smoker that would keep the blue smoke coming until the cows came home. I get NOTHING from this model. Tried testing by using dry wood chips (which I never use as it makes things bitter), damp chips, wet chips, etc. Not one freaking sign of smoke. When I open the wood chip tray it just has burnt looking wood on it every time. Hot enough to get the wood to fry out and burn, but not enough heat to get it to smoke. If it wasn't too late I would definitely send this back.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Corcoran

customer_reviews.title: Broke in a month (internal thermometer)
customer_reviews.text: At cold start shows 230F while inside temp is barely 90F. It can heat up a little bit then (you see red lamp - while heater is turned on) but it stops heating in a moment, because controller "thinks" that it's already target temperature. Will try to contact manufacturer, but return window is closed (1 month from purchase). All negative reviews are true, on low quality electronics.
customer_reviews.author: VS

customer_reviews.title: Need more smoke
customer_reviews.text: Used it once, there and there was not enough smoke coming from the wood chips and yes the problem obviously is the pan, it's much too small and too high from the heating element, my feeling is, masterbuilt should make a consideration and send us customers an improved pan, one which is deeper and wider to get it closer and also cover the whole heating element, I guess for now? I'll have to fabricate my own pan so, I can work with it.
customer_reviews.author: ACE-C

customer_reviews.title: Alright. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I finally caved and decided to buy an electric smoker after trying the $75 wood smokers and not being able to keep temp steady or low enough. This works well, but I think the wood chip tray needs to sit closer to the heating element. The wood only smokes at 240 degrees or higher. So, I start it off on a high temp to get the smoke going and then drop it, but after 30 min no more smoke. Still better than the one I was using though.
customer_reviews.author: PenName

customer_reviews.title: "cosmetic damage" - Ha!
customer_reviews.text: Totally smashed in corner so badly it broke the rivets on rear panel. Not the only seriously damaged smoker delivered according to my UPS driver. Insult to injust I had to lug a 70 lbs smoker to the UPS store to return. Amazon and vendor could have at least saved the paying customer that headache. Amazon Warehouse = caveat emptor.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Lee

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy, Faulty Digital Connector
customer_reviews.text: When I used this for the time to season it, it stayed on for about 30 minutes then would not turn on again. After checking the outlet and trying multiple outlets, I determined that the cause was a failure of the digital connector. Apparently this is an issue that Masterbuilt has known about and continues to sell this unit. Check their own website to see the number of complaints about this issue. Fortunately, I bought insurance on it and got my money back. I am now cautious about buying any smoker from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: Error Message After One Use
customer_reviews.text: Use once. Easy assembly. Worked great. Then comes the Saturday before Easter. Preheated. Stopped working after about an hour. Error message indicates temperature probe malfunctioning. Contacting manufacturer on Monday. Will update when situation corrected or item returned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke second use. Poor design.
customer_reviews.text: The temperature control panel broke the second use. It is not sealed (has a large opening on the back) and moisture built up inside it. It’s a bad design. How can you have an outdoor electric device that can’t withstand getting wet? Masterbuilt online warranty claims is impossible, finally got someone on the phone and said he is sending a replacement part, but I can only imagine it will break again due to the poor design.
customer_reviews.author: NewMidwesterner

customer_reviews.title: Digital Control Panel Broke Immediately
customer_reviews.text: I've had this smoker for three months and like in so many of the reviews on here the control panel almost immediately stopped working. I had it covered and under an overhead shelter when it wasn't in use and it still broke. I'm gonna try to get my money back I bet they're just going to send me another good for nothing panel. Go with something else.
customer_reviews.author: DeeTripleTee

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is my third master built smoker, just moved and gave my last one away. They should change the name to oven and not smoker. Smoker implies you will get smoke. The efficiency of the system brings it up to temp but doesn’t allow the pan to heat up the chips to gain any smoke with vent wide open. I have never had this issue with previous units, having to crank the temperature up to 275 to get any smoke. So much for low and slow. Disappointing purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: POS
customer_reviews.text: Trash. I'm on my second use in a month of ownership and it won't even turn the element on because it thinks the internal temperature is 300 degrees. My father in law got the "nicer" bluetooth model at the same time, and his controller was bad out of the box. After several back-and-forth "try this and that and that" his still isn't fixed. I'm probably just going to take it to the dump and try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Zimberg

customer_reviews.title: Not even used once. good thing I was inside when it blew up
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure what blew up on this unit. I think it was the heating element. I was in the process of curing the smoker when all of a sudden a big boom and a huge amount of smoke. It blew the door latch right off. I did return the unit for a full credit. I am still thinking of getting a smoker but sure will not be a Masterbuilt. I have seen a lot of negative reviews and would advise to run for the hills with this manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: crazybob123

customer_reviews.title: Order a size or two up, to smoke blocks not chips
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use as a first time smoker. Plug and play. But the drippings fall into the water pan. And also, the port on the side to insert chips is way too small. If I could go back I would order a size or two up that allows blocks of wood vs chips. Also, this doesn’t come with a meat thermometer, so bet on another $20 to buy one of those.
customer_reviews.author: Michigan Man

customer_reviews.title: Great for an electric smoker
customer_reviews.text: This thing was easy to set up and run. I never looked at the directions and had it going in no time at all. I smoked some salt and a pork loin in it before it was stolen.... It takes wood chips about once an hour. Smoke flavor was light, but I'm told that is just a limitation of an electric smoker. A smoke tube or maze could be added to increase the smoke. The pork loin was cooked to an internal temperature of 145 directly on the rack and was brought in, wrapped, and rested for 20 minutes. It came out perfectly moist and was great. It is really easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: B.C.

customer_reviews.title: It's got some problems.
customer_reviews.text: Safety instructions tell you to place the smoker 10 feet from walls, railings and overhangs. Well that is not possible because it comes with a 5 foot cord. So you also need an extension cord. But not just any extension cord, one that can handle the amperage of the smoker. No mention of this in the description before you buy. But they will sell you one if you can wait. It leaks grease and water so best to place it somewhere you don't mind getting greasy. Also it does not smoke at low temps, the chips just remain in the bottom of the smoker unless you turn the temp up to 240. Other than that it seems fine.
customer_reviews.author: Spiegel

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Horrible Horrible!!!
customer_reviews.text: To call this is smoker is a major misnomer. It smokes for about 15 minutes, then never again. Notice the wood chips aren’t even charred. Even though the digital control will read out numbers around 250 degrees, an internal over thermometer proves it is under 200 degrees. A 50 degree difference is NOT acceptable when cooking food!!! Cooking chicken breasts should take about 90 minutes, but ends up taking almost 3 hours due to the poor temperature control. Bottom line: DON’T BUT THIS SMOKER!!!
customer_reviews.author: William H.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy.. Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this 7 months ago and still going strong. Even used it in the dead of winter with a foot of snow on the ground. No issues with it. Just make sure if you move it around before you use it, to check to make sure the Wood tray didn't pop out of place. (Live and learn). You really don't need a window version, just buy a Bluetooth Temperature probe.
customer_reviews.author: Hammy

customer_reviews.title: Stay away.
customer_reviews.text: Stay away. I originally had this smoker about 10 years ago. It was fantastic. Worked beautifully. On this newest model they did changes to the design, and it's awful. It doesn't smoke. If you read the other reviews you'll see the same thing. The new design causes the wood to not smoke. I did the modifications others suggested- raise the heating element. Drill holes into the ash pan. Still very minimal smoke. The old design the whole block knew I was smoking. This design- I can barely tell. Don't waste your money on this.
customer_reviews.author: C. Farrugia

customer_reviews.title: Marginal product, bad customer service
customer_reviews.text: Bought this thing after numerous recommendations about Masterbuilt’s quality. 1.5 months after installation, I started having some issues with the control panel temperature buttons. I live in Florida so while I did install it under my covered patio, I suspect minor moisture was the culprit. But to be clear, the only moisture it was exposed to was humidity. I also have a fridge and 2 speakers in the same area for 2 years without any issues. I submitted a warranty claim for the defective control panel and have been waiting 2 months for the replacement with no end in sight... CS citing little else than covid for the delays which at this point is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Clerks

customer_reviews.title: Great fun and solid product.
customer_reviews.text: Love this smoker! Fun to use and convenient. I use it with the slow smoke attachment (bought later) which I also recommend. Good company with good ethics. Had a small problem and I sent one email and they took care of me right away, no hassles. I wish every company was so good to deal with. Good design and the costumer service made me a customer for life. Well done.
customer_reviews.author: HeloMech

customer_reviews.title: It isn't set it and forget it.
customer_reviews.text: The place where you keep the wood chips is very small. They have a "patent pending" way of refilling it, but honestly it is more for show. It doesn't work well. You have to keep refilling the wood chips if you are going to smoke over 2 hours, which I normally do. Also, the meat has a tendency to dry out. The design on the water doesn't really keep it moist inside. I gave it a three because it does smoke and you can cook meats with it, but I have had better electric smokers.
customer_reviews.author: C K Stephenson

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as it was...
customer_reviews.text: We had an older version that molded, long story, so we tossed that and bought another one because it was awesome! We got the new one and I noticed it was lighter, awesome again... I thought. It doesn't burn the wood chips at 225, the ideal temp for smoking... but it does at 235... basically, they are cutting corners now and it is noticeable in the product... it still made an amazing pork butt, but I won't be buying this masterbuilt again. Update... It just keeps getting worse. Even with modifying it, it still doesn't work right... We will be tossing this one and will not be buying it again. DO NOT BUY THIS MODEL!!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: We have had this smoker for 1 year, last week. My husband went out this morning to smoke our pork and the power board is broken. It will not turn on and stay on. Master built says it’s not under warranty and IT IS A KNOWN ISSUE! Our smoker has never been out in the elements, always kept in a garage. Will never buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy

customer_reviews.title: Worst customer service
customer_reviews.text: We used this 5 times and the temperature control stopped working. Yes, we are in a pandemic so we have given the company plenty of time to respond (stopped working early April) and they HAVE NOT REPLIED. We received a form email saying we would be contacted in 5 business days. But still NOTHING! I’m furious because this was a gift for my husband. It worked well four time but the fifth is when the temperature control quit. Customer service has been nonexistent even with the circumstances. It’s the middle of June. We should have at least been contacted by a person by now.
customer_reviews.author: kbritton

customer_reviews.title: Problem with interior of box
customer_reviews.text: Smoker box interior swelled after initial heating causing shelf grates to no longer fit properly. In process of working with Masterbuilt to obtain replacement.
customer_reviews.author: SFK

customer_reviews.title: Good so far!
customer_reviews.text: We've used the smoker 3x since father's day - easy to use. Just wish it had came with a "basics cook book" time & temps for meats. Spend a bit of time researching on what time to estimate cook times & temps. However, it's done a fine job on racks of ribs, keilbasa, chicken & a bourban soaked peach cobbler!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. H

customer_reviews.title: Seemed good until it wasn't
customer_reviews.text: Had the smoker for about 18 months. Got it during winter, so only really used it for about 12 months - most likely 20-30 times. Started blowing fuses. Sent a note to masterbuilt. Said I needed a new heating element, to call a number to order the part..and I'll have to pay shipping. I sent a follow-up message asking if it was common for Masterbuilt products to require replacement parts after 20-30 uses, heard nothing back. Will have a hard time pulling the trigger on another one of their products.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Batchelor

customer_reviews.title: Shocking
customer_reviews.text: Originally would've been a 5 star review... Got up this morning and went to smoke my ribs like I do 2x per week and the unit shocked me.... Cleaned everything and dried everything.... Didn't matter... Shocked again... I'll change this depending on the customer service I receive
customer_reviews.author: Gene Love

customer_reviews.title: Broke After Only a Few Uses
customer_reviews.text: I used the smoker about six times before it completely stopped working (doesn't turn on now). When I contacted Masterbuilt, they did send me a replacement part under warranty but it didn't fix the problem. Masterbuilt then failed to even respond to my follow-up emails and requests for assistance (due to COVID, there call center is closed so email is the only option). The bottom line is it's a terrible smoker and a terrible company.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Smoker!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband as his Christmas present and he loves it. The few things that had to be assembled were super easy. We have used this 3-4 times so far and we have had no problems with it. It's held the temperature every time. Everything seems well made. I've looked at many smokers and so far, this purchase as exceeded my expectations. The price was great and the product itself is great! At this point in time, I would purchase this again for my family or as a gift for someone else.
customer_reviews.author: Kassandra Hopper

customer_reviews.title: Love the Electric Smoker
customer_reviews.text: I find that the loading mechanism and everything else works great. One word of caution, be sure to run it empty to burn off chemicals before your first smoke. I don't think this is in the instructions, but I'm glad I did this. I bought a probe thermometer to slip in the smoke vent so I can keep tabs on the meat temperature as it rises. I brined and smoked a turkey for thanksgiving that was awesome. Pork butt and cowboy ribeye steaks as well. The adjustable, removable shelves are great. This may not do everything a pit master expects from a smoker, but for an easy, affordable backyard option, you can't do much better than this.
customer_reviews.author: Crow T Robot

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't come with legs. Massive fail, other than that it works like it should
customer_reviews.text: Should have charged us the end-user $20 more for legs, and handles. No handles on the side to carry this smoker around, also no legs, so you better expect to bend all the way down to move your meat in and out of the smoker. Other than those two flaws, this is a great smoker. Not realistic to smoke 3 layers of meat though, stick with one rack (the bottom rack) when you smoke your meat for better result.
customer_reviews.author: Acytoh

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this smoker. I am not patient enough to use charcoal and I was afraid that electric would somehow take away from the experience as well as the flavor of the meat. I was wrong. We've done a brisket at 5 hours using hickory and a brisket at 12 hours using hickory and both turned out amazingly juicy and tender with the smoke flavor permeating through. At first, I was worried because I was expecting a large amount of smoke from the vent. I only see occasional puffs of smoke coming from this smoker but it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: E. Smith

customer_reviews.title: I Love It!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this smoker. I've never had a smoker before and I love the fact that this is an electric smoker and doesn't require a propane tank. Although it is very light I found it awkward to move it from our garage to our patio. I attached it to a MaxWorks 80854 Polypropylene Dolly which I bought from Amazon. It's the perfect combination (after attaching 2 wood pieces to lift the smoker slightly - attach the wood to the smoker with supplied foot bolts then screw the dolly to the wood)!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Smoker
customer_reviews.text: This is my first electric smoker, I've had a small charcoal smoker and found this is the way to go. As the commercial goes just set it and forget it. Tried smoking a whole chicken first and although the meat was very good the skin was not edible. I have since read a little more about how to crisp the skin so will try it again. Smoked ribs and they came out great. This smoker is a good buy as a starter smoker.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon fan

customer_reviews.title: SMOKER
customer_reviews.text: ONLY USED IT 4 TIMES AND THE CONTROL PANEL STOPPED WORKING. IT TURNS ON BUT CANNOT SET TIMER OR TEMPERATURE AND THE SHUTS OFF. THE CONTROL PANEL DOES NOT WORK..MUST BE DEFECTIVE..NEEDS TO BE REPLACED. WHILE IT WAS WORKING WE LOVED IT..COOKED CHICKEN , RIBS AND BEEF BRISKET ON IT. HOPE YOU CAN HELP US OUT BY SENDING NEW CONTROL PANEL. THANK YOU
customer_reviews.author: SHEILA

customer_reviews.title: Garbage. Can't hit promised 275 degrees.
customer_reviews.text: For the first few months it worked great. Set the temp, food was ready when expected. Recently (little less than a year) it will not hit its promised top temperature of 275 degrees. It is off by about 30 degrees (will only go to 240 now). I've kept it in my fully enclosed garage when not in use and have taken great care of it. DON'T BUY THIS PIECE OF JUNK!
customer_reviews.author: P. Starr

customer_reviews.title: Why wont it hold temperature consistent?
customer_reviews.text: I like this smoker, I smoked chicken quarters on it and ribs and it worked great. doesn't produce a lot of smoke but one thing I have noticed is that the temp inside the unit is always changing! if I set it to 225 it constantly changes from 220- 235 and is never dead set on 225. what am I doing wrong? I have water in the pan, the vent all the way open and wood chips in the chip tray? any advice? UPDATE***** Now it will not smoke and will consistently go from 10 degrees off and 15 degrees off. I am returning this product ASAP and will never buy it again. Waste of money!!
customer_reviews.author: Dane

customer_reviews.title: Great smoker!
customer_reviews.text: I like the way this smoker operates. The racks, drip pan, and other components are easy to insert and remove. The smoker retains heat throughout the cooking process. The only thing that I dislike is the LED display. It cannot be read even in indirect sunlight. I have to cup my hand around the display and look closely at it to set the time and temp. Overall, I would recommend this smoker to those who are learning how to smoke food and those who experienced with smoke cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Treeswan

customer_reviews.title: You'll wait a long time to get this and it'll be damaged
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the first smoker on 9/8/20. On the 20th I unboxed it, to find it badly damaged, I immediately exchanged it and on October 4th we opened the new one. It's going back today. Not only was it damaged, but the leveling feet on the bottom were missing. The pictures are the first one, the video is the second. Avoid this
customer_reviews.author: MarkM

customer_reviews.title: No Smoke ring, but works as intended
customer_reviews.text: Heads up, that getting a smoke ring in this is extremely difficult. If that's important to you, I would not get this (its just for looks anyway). I've smoked 2 Briskets and 3 Pork butts in this so far and I've gotten better each time. When I first started my wood chips were not smoking at 225~ or so, adding foil between the Holder and heating coil helped solve this. Great smoker for first timer use!
customer_reviews.author: shivalm

customer_reviews.title: Read all reviews several models come out of the box not working!
customer_reviews.text: This grill came out of the box NOT working! Unfortunately for me i work 70-80 hours a week and I did not get a chance to open and put together until yesterday.....seems to have no power regardless of where it’s plugged in. Was really looking forward to smoking a lot of things this summer it’s a shame that now I will have to buy a new smoker but it DEF will not be a charbroil.
customer_reviews.author: S. Murrell

customer_reviews.title: Won't burn wood chips
customer_reviews.text: Over all, I like the unit. Built well, easy to assemble. I like the temp control and the timer. What I don't like is I have wood chips that I used in my old smoker. This unit will not burn those chips. You have to make slivers, like the size of match sticks to get it to smoke. Keeping the smoke going requires a lot of effort and attention. If you're going to smoke a turkey be prepared to be on top of it all day long.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Definition of Entry Level
customer_reviews.text: It was great when I first got it but, I easily outgrew it in only a couple months. Size is extremely limited. Ribs have to be cut in half and often overlap. Cheese is a no-go without adding a pellet tray. There is no “smoke only” mode. It’s always been in the shade and covered when not in use but somehow the plastic handle broke. Wood chip tray is so small you find yourself having to constantly add more.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Easley

customer_reviews.title: Within 4 uses the unit trips the GFI on outlets.
customer_reviews.text: What a joke.....can't even use it on a GFI outlet after a few uses. Too late for me to return it through Amazon so I tried to contact Masterbuilt....but they are not answering phone due to COVID. What a disappointment!! When I went to google this there are lots of customers that have had this same trouble. Do not buy a Masterbuilt Electric Smoker.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryle L Paisley

customer_reviews.title: First time smoker
customer_reviews.text: received my first smoker and couldn’t be any happier, easy to assemble and easy to use. 4 tray for meats, pizza or whatever you like to smoke. Adding chips to the smoker is very easy and the video that you can see before ordering tells you how to use the smoker. Light weight so it’s easy to move around if you want to bring it to camp. Door locks. The temperature cage is true and keeps the smoker at the temperature you desire.
customer_reviews.author: Tindaro

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to!
customer_reviews.text: Super simple smoker that can handle a lot. Wish the temperature would go a little higher overall, but ours has run like a champ so far. Temp on the internal sensor is a little +/- but everybody that's smoking likely has (OR SHOULD GET) a wired or wireless probe to get a second opinion reading. Did a whole turkey for thanksgiving that was perfect. Pork butt, burnt ends, even smoked bologna and hot dogs... all turned out great. Get it pre-heated, get your stuff in, and refill chips about every 30 min. Dinner.
customer_reviews.author: Jason L. Furrer

customer_reviews.title: Side wood chip loading system is oval, not round and flimsy.  Hard to get in/out.
customer_reviews.text: I like this product a lot (I have 2 of the same at our cabin in Alaska). Problem with this one is that the Side wood chip loading system is oval, not round and flimsy. Hard to get in/out and it appears that it is ready to break (my 2 in Alaska are more sturdy). Tried to find a way of contacting the seller hoping to get a replacement of just the loading system apparatus not wanting to replace the whole unit. I will redo my review if I get the replacement otherwise, I will be sendingthe whole unit back.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this smoker. Some of the screwholes were off a little which was aggravating. We used it 4 times and have been so happy with the outcome. Have also watched the videos on Utube and they have been helpful. Good value for your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No smoke
customer_reviews.text: I gave this smoker a 2 out of 5 stars because it doesn’t smoke. It’s been used about 5 times now and has smoked 2 out of the 5 times. I have tried to smoke fish and chicken and they both ended up being baked like in the oven. Very dissatisfied with this product. Also when it did produce a little smoke we had to add wood chips every 30 minutes kinda takes away the whole point of a electric smoker.
customer_reviews.author: Hanna Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Great Smoker
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for an older model masterbuilt smoker that suddenly died. Easy to install the few parts and works great. If you put water or other liquid like apply cider it holds temperature great
customer_reviews.author: david Coen

customer_reviews.title: Great smoker!
customer_reviews.text: Has changed the way we smoke our meats. We are currently using the Hickory smoking chips and the flavor in everything we have cooked so far has been excellent. Only thing we have noticed is that the cooking times are much faster than what is suggested so the first few times we used it the meat was a bit overcooked but now that we have a feel for the cook times no issues at all!
customer_reviews.author: M Burton

customer_reviews.title: What a great Smoker!!  Buy this one!!
customer_reviews.text: Used it to smoke a turkey. 13 pounds and it took roughly 10 hours. No window makes it necessary to open the door to check the meat. That will burn your eyes because of the smoke. But you need to baste anyway so maybe a non point. Otherwise I was able to put it together and start using it right away. Nice and Big interior. Excellent catch tray. If you aren't using a smoker you should start.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: Does not produce smoke other than at max temperature
customer_reviews.text: Have to agree with the reviewers who mention that this does not produce smoke at temperatures under 275 (the highest temperature settling), which kind of defeats the purpose of a smoker on a number of levels. I ended up purchasing the cold smoke attachment, which hasn’t arrived yet, but obviously this should not be necessary to get smoke with a smoker. Very aggravated and would have returned it but can’t decide if it’s with the trouble.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Good for Smoking at Higher Temps (250-275)
customer_reviews.text: I basically really like this product. It was easy to assemble, reasonable price and enough space for my needs. As others have noted, it's a little hard to get smoke going at lower temps. Some modified as noted in previous posts. I tried that and it did indeed work. My longer term solution was to purchase the slow smoker attachment. That allows me to have any temperature (or heat completely off) and get all the smoke I need. So far it's been reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Sheba

customer_reviews.title: Works great.  This one's a Winner.
customer_reviews.text: virtually no set up. works great. I even used it when the temp outside was in the 20s F. Not sure if this will shorten its life, but nice to know it lasted the 8 hours needed. The food comes out very tasty. Best turkey Ive ever made. I use very few chips and it has a nice smokey flavor, not overwhelming.
customer_reviews.author: Oujdat

customer_reviews.title: Product supprt is not good...
customer_reviews.text: I used this smoker 3 times and it quit working. Something smoked and it wasn't the meat inside. The digital display quit working no heat, very disappointing. We contacted customer support and it took well over a month to receive parts that I had to install and it still didn't work. Customer support is very, very slow...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Will only smoke on high temperatures. Its a cooker and not a smoker.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Wickline

customer_reviews.title: Works good some of the time
customer_reviews.text: We have used the smoker 4 times now and twice the digital unit on top started acting funny. The first time, I ended up unplugging the unit from the smoker and it reset. Last night I gave up on it when it wouldn't let me set the temp but this morning I tried it and it came on like its supposed to. When it works correctly, the smoker does an incredible job on chicken and ribs. I'm just scared to plan an outing with it now because I don't know whether or not it will work when I need it to.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No smoke after 4 uses & horrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: After working well the smoker quit producing enough smoke to "smoke" the meat. The initial response to my issues was some trouble shooting, none of which worked. I was then told to call customer service, but was on hold for over 30 minutes. Next I contacted Masterbuilt through Facebook, but this time through messaging I was told it was something I was doing wrong. Despite telling them repeatedly that I used it several times with success, they keep pushing the blame on me. Worst of all - they will not call and speak to me on the phone and I cannot reach them. Super frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Janelle Spencer

customer_reviews.title: good smoker for the money
customer_reviews.text: I'm satisfied with the performance of the smoker so far. However I am in agreement with some of the reviews about the digital controller- its junk I don't see it lasing. I'm also starting to see some paint bubbling around the door jamb on the inside of the smoker. As it gets worse I will scrape it off I don't like the idea of bubbling paint where my meat is cooking. Because of the poor quality of the digital controller I would recommend buying the analog version of this smoker and then buying a good meat thermometer with blue tooth so you can monitor remotely. It does make some great smoked meats.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Better Shipping Required
customer_reviews.text: I understand this is a larger item however this was delivered to my home in the manufacturers box. My boyfriend and I came home and there it was in the driveway. Unfortunately, this was his Christmas gift so his suprise was spoiled.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Great Value! Works as intended!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and works great as long as you are not trying to smoke meat in really cold weather. Has a little trouble maintaining temperature if it is 40 degrees F or colder. Most recipes call for 225 F cooking temps and it struggles but you can set it higher and it works well. I should have purchased the one with a see through front but this one was a good starter smoker. That being said everything I have smoked on it has turned out excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: So far I have used this three times and have been pleased with the results. The instructions were straight forward for assembly. I did have an issue with the two plastic feet for the front. When installing one of the feet broke and the plastic they are made of does not seem durable. Masterbuilt sent a replacement foot and I have not installed the feet yet as it can be used without. Overall I have been very pleased with how easy this is to use!
customer_reviews.author: William W Boyd III

customer_reviews.title: Love everything about it!
customer_reviews.text: My husband LOVES to grill and now smoke so this was an awesome Christmas gift! Used it on Christmas Eve and Christmas Day and he is having a great time expirimenting with different receipes., Also bought for both of my boys for Christmas and we are believers! I do suggest getting something to elevate it - otherwise you have to bend down everytime to open/close the door.
customer_reviews.author: nattimom

customer_reviews.title: Beginner smoker
customer_reviews.text: This was my first smoker and i would say its great quality and value. Cooks and smokes food without any problems. My only issue would be the temperature control. Its about 5 to10 degrees off from external probes i used. All probes where within 2 degrees of each other while the temperature setting was 5 to 10 off from then. Other then that workes great
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: A great smoker!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Masterbuilt MES 130B Digital Electric Smoker. The first failed bc of my negligence to properly weather-proof it (Great Lakes weather). The first had a control panel flush with the top of the smoker. Water got under the plastic cover of the panel and it was finished. This version has a mounted control panel that can be removed for storage. The smoker heats quickly and maintains temperature. I've used all kinds of wood and meats with excellent results.
customer_reviews.author: Drew D

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work properly
customer_reviews.text: My hubs received this as his birthday gift. We seasoned the unit this morning and turned it on to smoke our first chicken. It would get to about 180 degrees and give us an error message. So we followed instructions to reset. This happened about 6 more times. Now when we plug it back in it won’t even reset. Just beeps and gives the error message. Going back.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Definitely would recommend this model MB20071117
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was bad due to black Friday. It arrived 2 weeks late (fed-x ground) The seller , VM Express was a pleasure to deal with. You actually speak to an American when you call! The Masterbuilt Smoker MB20071117 arrived without a scratch! It was packaged very well. I have smoked ribs a few times. A pork shoulder. A couple of chickens, fish and mac & cheese recipe from the owners manual. Everything cooked great. It is very well insulated. I purchased a $9.00 off brand cover that is nice. I have read all the reviews and haven't had ANY of the issues i read about. So i would have to reccomend this model. Happy Smokin !
customer_reviews.author: Bill from Lake Butler, Florida

customer_reviews.title: ... it twice so far and the briskets turn out great! I'm going to start preparing for Thanksgiving so ...
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it twice so far and the briskets turn out great! I'm going to start preparing for Thanksgiving so that will be my next culinary work out. The Master-built videos make even a novice like me cook like a pro.
customer_reviews.author: techfella

product_meta.title: Masterbuilt MB20071117 Digital Electric Smoker, 30 inch, Black
product_meta.description: Pattern Name:SmokerThe Masterbuilt 30-inch Digital Electric Smoker is perfect for the beginner or the pro. You’ll achieve competition-ready results in your own backyard, without the hassle of charcoal or propane. Simply plug this smoker in, set the digital controls, and it does the work! The patented side wood chip loader lets you experiment with flavor without opening the smoker door. Four chrome-coated racks provide plenty of room to smoke up to 6 chickens, 2 turkeys, 4 racks of ribs, or 4 pork butts. Master the art of smoking with Masterbuilt.
feature_bullets: Digital panel controls on/off, cooking temperature and time
Patented side wood chip loading system allows you to add wood chips without opening door
Thermostat-temperature control for even, consistent smoking
Water bowl to add moisture and flavor
Wood chip tray for easy ash removal

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars2,004 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
